DOCNAME: CASE OF PRETTO AND OTHERS v. ITALY
TEXT: CARDINAL . Mr. PERSON , an NORP citizen , for DATE farmed , with the help of members of his family , land at FAC Vicenza ) of which he was the tenant .

In DATE , the owner entered into a preliminary contract with a certain Mr. PERSON for the sale of the property at a price of CARDINAL GPE . In accordance with section CARDINAL of ORG no . CARDINAL of CARDINAL DATE - " PERSON per lo sviluppo della proprietà coltivatrice " ) , he informed Mr. PERSON of the conclusion of this contract .

Mr. PERSON gave notice of his intention to exercise the right of pre - emption ( " diritto di prelazione " ) conferred on him by LAW . Nevertheless , by deed dated DATE , the owner sold the land to the brother - in - law of Mr. PERSON for the price that had been agreed with the latter .

CARDINAL . On DATE , Mr. PERSON brought an action before ORG seeking the re - sale of the land to him by the new owner ( azione di riscatto ) . He complained of the failure to respect his right of pre - emption and alleged that the price indicated in the contract was fictitious : according to ORG valuation , the land was in fact only worth CARDINAL GPE . The applicant stated that he was willing to offer the new owner the price actually paid or , alternatively , the price shown in the sale contract or , in the further alternative , such price as ORG might determine .

The defendant pleaded that the action was inadmissible since Mr. PERSON had not made an unconditional offer of the price mentioned in the contract . He also claimed that the plaintiff could in any event no longer avail himself of his right of pre - emption as he had not paid the said amount within the DATE period laid down by LAW no . CARDINAL .

CARDINAL . ORG gave judgment on DATE . It held that Mr. PERSON was entitled to have the land re - sold to him at the price specified in the contract , such price to be paid not DATE and DATE from the date on which the judgment became final .

CARDINAL . On DATE , the new owner appealed to ORG which , after postponing the hearings CARDINAL times at the request of both parties , reversed ORG decision by a judgment of CARDINAL DATE , which was deposited in ORG registry on DATE . ORG found that although Mr. PERSON ’s action had been admissible , he was estopped from availing himself of his right to obtain a re - sale since he had not paid the price stated in the sale contract within DATE of the commencement of the proceedings at first instance . It held that this time - limit had to apply , by analogy with the rules on the exercise of the right of pre - emption ( section CARDINAL of Act no . CARDINAL ) .

CARDINAL . On DATE , Mr. PERSON appealed on points of law to ORG . The respondent lodged a cross - appeal ( ricorso incidentale ) on DATE and the applicant filed a reply thereto ( controricorso ORG ricorso incidentale ) on CARDINAL DATE .

On a date which it has not been possible to trace ( see paragraph CARDINAL in fine above ) , the President of the CARDINALrd ORG of ORG directed that the hearings be held on DATE . The applicants claimed that previously Mr. PERSON had twice asked for the case to be dealt with , but that for reasons beyond their control they were unable to prove this .
On DATE , Mr. PERSON filed a supplementary memorial ; under LAW , he was permitted to do so up to DATE before the hearings .

On DATE , ORG postponed the hearings : as section CARDINAL of Act no . CARDINAL had given rise to conflicting judicial decisions , it considered it preferable to await the ruling of ORG on other appeals bearing on the same point .

ORG was to have sat on DATE , but in fact did not give judgment until DATE . On DATE , the CARDINALrd ORG applied that decision and dismissed Mr. PERSON ’s appeal ; it confirmed ORG interpretation of LAW no . CARDINAL . The full text of the judgment was made public by being deposited in ORG registry on DATE . LAW , which save for some rare exceptions applies to all civil court judgments , whether rendered at first instance , on appeal or on cassation , in fact provides ( translation from the NORP ) :

" The judgment ( sentenza ) shall be made public by being deposited in the registry of the court which delivered it . The Registrar shall record at the bottom of the judgment that it has been deposited , adding the date and his signature ; within DATE , he shall advise the parties ( parti che si sono costituite ) of the deposit by means of a written notice which shall contain the operative provisions of the judgment . "
Under LAW no . CARDINAL of DATE ( rules on the application of LAW and transitional provisions ) , the deposit has to be effected within DATE of the examination of the case .
CARDINAL . On DATE , the judgment was served on Mr. PERSON by the respondent and thereupon became enforceable .

CARDINAL . Anyone can consult or obtain copies of the judgments of ORG on application to its registry . If judgments contain features that are novel from the point of view of interpretation of the law , they may be published .
